p: However, CT decontamination is essential after scanning COVID-19 patients, which may disarray radiological service accessibility and advocates that chest radiography may lessen the risk of cross-infection [ 66]. In COVID-19, chest X-ray (CXR) shows patchy or diffuse reticular-nodular opacities and consolidation, with basal, peripheral and bilateral predominance [ 67]. The consideration of CXR for early detection may contribute an important role in the regions around the world with limited access to RT-PCR COVID testing [ 66].
